comment_text: I’m shocked to see you post this video. I happen to not be a chemist but watched this video right after seeing you in another video clearly handeling fuming nitric acid while wearing black nitrile gloves. I’m sure you probably have already been given enough hassle over this but maybe edit the original videos that have footage of this behavior so there’s a note on screen for the idiots of the world that might try to attempt things people on YouTube make videos of? I mean no disrespect and respect the work and it’s been an amazing thing for me to start learning terminology for chemistry before I get into school.
Will Yellow strain of nitric acid disappear after few days or not ?
Could someone make hydrofluoric acid from toothpaste?
வேற லெவல் பண்ணுங்க ப்ரோ
Many rocket fuel chemists experimented with WFNA and RFNA to get the best thrust, and lowest ignition delay for hypergolic rocket engines.

I recently worked with fuming nitric acid for the first time. And I wasn't prepaired at all. I was unfamiliar with the lab and I was cleaning some glass ware and a more experienced lab member told me "Oh looks like you are going to need nitric acid to get that off. I'll just hand you some." You can imagine my face when I was handed a beaker of the angriest liquid I have ever seen. I immedatly rembembered this and considered myself lucky that I wasn't wearing any gloves. The fuming nitric acid was so angry the fumes alone stained my hands. Fortunatly everything went well, but boy did I shit myself. Usually I would have been pretty pissed, but I was too shocked to be angry.

When I confronted him later about it he was incredibly sorry and said he totally forgot that I was new. Apparently the only nitric acid they have is fuming nitric acid and anybody who has been in that lab for a while is pretty used to handling that stuff once in a while.
Jhoniel 😊💙

Yikes!  I live out in the Rocky Mountains in Canada and there is a small local hardware store near me that has various drain openers.  They have the usual alkaline drain openers like Drano, but they also have sulfuric acid ones and another one that uses 88% Nitric acid.  Its comes in a thick PVC container that is also wrapped with heavy duty plastic.  I was considering trying it out but now I'm scared after seeing this video.

So, from these comments... Fuming nitric acid vs. skin = mild acid burns and skin discolouration; fuming nitric acid vs. protective gloves = massive flaming mess of doom. Dammit, those things are supposed to help. :(

I agree with the "no gloves are better than nitril or latex. I have had the awesome yellow stains on my skin several times and never received an actual burn. As an experiment I placed a tiny drop of 96% white fuming nitric on the back of one finger for one minute. The burn was annoying (like lemon juice in a paper cut) and in any normal condition I would have been inclined to wash it off within seconds. The resulting burn was 1st degree and never more than a red spot. I say, concentrate safety efforts to the eyes and face.
